p: We recorded two-way migrations in all regions analyzed. The largest number of migrants (195.40) in P. guyannensis was recorded from the central region (Araguari basin) to the South region (Jari River, the Amazon and Par√° rivers). The second greatest number of migrants (82.60) was recorded between the North region (Oiapoque River and Maroni River), and the South. The lowest values were recorded from the Central region to the North with number of migrants varying between 21.70 and 50.70 ( Table 3). In P. cuvieri, the largest numbers of migrants moved from the North to the Central region, and vice versa. The numbers of migrants recorded between the other regions were much smaller, and well balanced around 60.00 ( Table 3).
